intro: Henriettella flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered Henriettella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Henriettella flavescens is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to extreme environmental conditions.
